name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed for 7 nights in room 331 in the Banyan Wing last week. I love this place so much I dream about it. The room and bathroom were newly remodeled, the AC worked great, the beds were comfy, a newspaper was slipped under the door every morning. Our room had a porch that overlooked the courtyard and the ocean. Each night I would sit out and listen to the tide come in and the sounds of the Polynesian band playing below. (Band and hula every night in the courtyard.) There aren't any bugs, just a nice breeze.
reviews.title: Loved it- I would live there if I could!

likes.liked: — The beauty, history, and quality service and food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant almost every morning for breakfast. They have a great buffet (I have greatly missed the smoked salmon with cream cheese, capers, etc.!). We ate dinner at the restaurant 3 times. I highly recommend the Maui French Onion soup (my husband and I had that all three times!) and the chocolate spring roll dessert. The filet was so tender you could cut it with a butter knife.
reviews.title: First Lady Indeed

likes.disliked: — limited open window(4 inches), noisy air conditioning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff was friendly and helpful. I have no complaints whatsoever. This was the nicest hotel stay/vacation I have ever had. We didn't even turn on the TV once!
reviews.title: LOVED THIS HOTEL

likes.liked: — They are very organized. Everything went real smooth with checking in and our luggage.
likes.disliked: — How they take reservations for pool chairs and returning costumers come first. Its like picking favorites.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 5 nites in March 08. I took advice from other "tripadvisors" and upgrade to oceanview in Banyan Wing. Room is indeed small but everything seems new under Westin. I was only expecting an ocean room with most of the view being blocked by the 100-year-old tree. Surprised! We got the corner unit (room 323), with one window overlooking the Waikiki beach and the other over the courtyard. (See attached photos) Other "advisors" complained about the musicians performing at the courtyard in the evening, but we enjoyed it. How can you beat it with sound of waves from one window and Hawaiian music from the other!
reviews.title: Less than Perfect

likes.disliked: — Food quality inconsistancy. Room small and drab in relation to price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach bar is a lovely place. You are 10 feet from the vibrant beach yet having nice shade under the old tree(I am not crazy about tan). Food is slightly above average, both quality and price wise. Staff are extremely nice and friendly. My small complains are noisy air conditioning, and having to have stand while waiting for the Tour desk to help me book tours. Management shoud add a few chairs in that area. I also agree with other "advisors" that it is annoying to have to tip staff and reserve hotel's lounge chair. In the afternoon, many "reserved" chairs are empty. What a waste!
reviews.title: Style and charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed (6) days at the "Moana" and (6) days at the "Hilton Hawiian Village". We booked an Ocean View room w/ balcony in the Tower Wing, with a king size bed. Upon arrival, my husband and I were greeted with a lei greeting and a cold drink. The check-in staff was courteous, and greeted us with a smile. Check in was easy, and the hotel itself is the most beautiful in Waikiki.
reviews.title: What a beauty !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location Location Location! Right in the middle of everything, no need to rent a car. Bus stop up the street if you feel comfortable taking the city bus. We opted to take the city bus everywhere. Cheap @ $2.00 pp.
reviews.title: Grand hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The pool is small, dont expect to get a lounge chair around the pool unless you make a reservation for one by 1pm the day before. I found no problem getting a beach chair and umbrella on the beach with no reservation at all. It was usually in the corner behind the lifeguard station, but I didnt mind. If you want a beach chair in the front row closest to the beach, then you HAVE to reserve one by 1pm the day before. Rentals for beach chairs and lounges around the pool are free, unlike the "Hilton", which charges almost $60.00 for them!
reviews.title: Noise, Noise, Noise !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The beach area is VERY small and busy. And lots of waves if you like that sort of thing. the "Hilton Hawiian Village" had a bigger beach and calmer waters, but not close to the center of Waikiki, like the "Moana" was.
reviews.title: Loved the Moana!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The "Moana" closes their pool at like 5 or 6pm. The "Hilton" closes theirs at 10pm, and they have a spot-light on their beach, which allows for night swimming. Moana does not. Several people, including myself, went swimming until 9 & 10pm!
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

likes.liked: — The beauty of the hotel and prime location on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009
reviews.text: I've been to Oahu many times and have always wanted to say at the Westin.
reviews.title: The Westin MADE my Hawaii trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reason 1: The hotel is beautiful
reviews.title: This Hotel Met Every Expectation and Then Some

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Reason 2: Location (across from the market place, next to Dukes)
reviews.title: IS THIS WAIKIKI

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Reason 3: The Ocean FRONT rooms are as close to the beach you can get
reviews.title: Over-Rated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Arrived and was greated with a lay, a beverage, and refreshing towel.
reviews.title: wow. w-w-w-w-w-w-wow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent six nights at the Moana Surfrider at the end of our honeymoon. The hotel was immaculate and well appointed, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The terraces, restaurants and beach bar were great, if not a little expensive. The central location with easy access to the beach, shops and restaurants made this a fantastic choice for our stay.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

likes.disliked: — The restaurant and bar were quite expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I got a good deal on this hotel on a stay 3 pay 2 deal thru Escape Travel. This is my favourite style of hotel and it's location with direct access to Waikiki Beach was a selling point. The Bar which has the most lethal mai tais is smack back under the 105 year old Banyan tree and on the beach. The rooms were magic and the beds divine. The rooms are not the largest I have stayed in but I was quite happy as it was only me. She s a beautiful hotel and if you can afford to stay here, do. Even if it is for a couple of nights.
reviews.title: Glorious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our daughter's wedding was in Honolulu, and we booked a room for her and her husband at the Moana as part of a Japan Air Lines package.
reviews.title: Honeymooners hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is gorgeous. The bride and groom's room was on the 20th floor of the Tower Wing and had a wonderful view. They were totally satisfied with "the best hotel room they have ever stayed in." That opinion was , perhaps, glossed by the fact they were honeymooners.
reviews.title: Expensive but lovely

likes.liked: — The beauty of the hotel, our view, the bedding
likes.disliked: — The lack of reasonable food options, the stuffiness of some staff (eg at the pool), the bathroom towels!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a lot of time in the lobby and at the Beach Bar. The lobby is a pleasant place to meet and chat. The Beach Bar offers decent drinks and food and a wonderful atmosphere. Although some reviews have complained about the high prices at the bar, we found them to be no more than we pay for drinks and light meals in Japan where we live.
reviews.title: charming hotel, prime location, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The day we arrived, the street was blocked for a "block party". The airport van dropped us off at a different Sheraton located nearby, that hotel called our Sheraton and a young man showed up with one of those luggage/clothes carts. He had pushed it up the street to where we were. Once again, I was immediately impressed by the service we got at Sheraton. Our room was upgraded to a higher floor (still a partial ocean view) and we ended up in a corner room that was bigger than the first floor of my condo. Two balconies - one with the partial ocean view, the other with a city/mountain view.
reviews.title: 25th Anniversary - Sheraton did it up right

likes.liked: — The HUGE room and of course the double balconies
likes.disliked: — Always say the vacation is for a special purpose - ie anniversary. You stand a much better chance of gettig some perks not in the brochures.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The private beach was small in comparison to ones at home, but clean and service was good. If you wanted to reserve a small table with umbrella, you had to do it that morning, and show up before a certain time. Huge demand for the tables. Once settled in, though, it was relatively safe because the hotel watched very carefully to make sure only Hotel guests used that section of beach.
reviews.title: Pure heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We choose to eat out most of the time for our main meal. We did have lunch a few times at the ocean bar and found it pricey. We got great food deals across the street. We used "Hawaii for Dummy's" to find three restaurants and were not disappointed in any of them. What with the overall cost of going first class, I would strongly recommend this book for first-timers. I compared the hotels we looked at with the book and TripAdvisor - both were quite thorough and to the point about the same places.
reviews.title: Great hotel but make sure you get what you were guaranteed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An activity for the less physical is taking a catamaran ride - a great way to see a section of the island you are on, and we found the crew very friendly and attentive. There was one that used the beach right in front of us, and another just down the beach about 300 feet. For the more physical, there is always the trek up Diamond Head (which you can see from the beach). I didn't do it, but some who did said it was absolutely beautiful.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous

likes.liked: — Loved the wonderful feel of the property and outstanding service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We would go back in a New York Minute!
reviews.title: So much to offer!

likes.disliked: — Room could have been a bit larger and decorated more colorfully

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: attempted an early check-in, however our room wasn't ready. and how does the staff take care of us and show their apologies for not being able to meet our request? we were given a key to a hospitality suite where we could change freshen up. WHAT? they let us use a room with a shower for free when we showed up at 11:00am...and check-in wasnt even until 3:00pm. and we were given moistened towelettes. i am a sucker for moistened towelettes.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great location....rooms very small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: flash forward to when i actually got in my room. within the first 30 minutes, i received a birthday cake from the general manager. shock and awe, much? how did he know i was there for my birthday?!
reviews.title: Ultimately it's the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OH! and then there was the beach bar. i totally wished i remembered her name, but our server at the beach bar was A-MAZING! she was there when we needed her every time...even when we called the hotel operator from our cell phone and asked to be connected to the beach bar and then asked for our server (at that time we remembered her name) and then asked her to come to the poolside lounge chairs to take our drink order because we were simply too relaxed (read: mai-tai-ed) to move.
reviews.title: Great location, good beach, disappointed with the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i could go on and on about the beauty of the moana surfrider, but for me, it always must be backed up by quality service...and that is what i remember. thank you, to you mr. berger and the entire crew of the moana surfrider.
reviews.title: Brilliant view - Wonderful Location - Loved Hawaii!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is awesome, great location, beautiful beach!! Checking in was fairly easy, we were first assigned rooms in the historic wing. Very small and the view was awful!! We requested new rooms in the tower wing and the desk clerk was able to upgrade us to partial ocean view. The rooms were much better and a nice view(ocean and city). The staff was very friendly and helpful. We didn't eat at the hotel, very expensive!! Every kind of store you could imagine was within walking distance. We enjoyed the beach bar and the entertainment was nice too! I would have to say the beach was my favorite though, really enjoyed the view and listening to the surf. We will defitinitly be back next year!!
reviews.title: Pefect Vacation!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: We received complimentary upgrades to ocean view rooms so we awoke each morning to the blue sky and ocean and went to sleep each night to the sound of the pounding waves ! This resort offers the perfect location for both shopping and excursions. We especially enjoyed the plantation vibe during the evening hours when you can sit in one of the veranda rocking chairs and watch all the street action with a nice gentle breeze to keep you cool . The staff is excellent, very friendly and attentive. Never have had such comfy mattresses along with great food, breakfast buffets were awesome !! If we are lucky enough to return, this will always be our first choice for lodging !! Two huge thumbs up !!! Can't say one negative thing about this resort !
reviews.title: Pure Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: For the price, a small and unremarkable room. Moreover, I was facing the street instead of the beach and was therefore serenaded by buskers until nearly midnight, even on weeknights.
reviews.title: Plusses and minuses

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We felt pampered from the second we set foot in the door until the minute we left. The view from our ocean view room in the historic wing was spectacular. We watched surfers and sailboats and all the activity on the beach from our hotel room window. The banyon tree in the courtyard is one of the coolest looking trees I have ever seen! Drinks at the beachside bar under the tree are a must. Pass on the bar food though - it's not so great.
reviews.title: Four days in paradise...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: In general, things here were adequate, but I was disappointed. There were hidden charges in addition to the already-inflated cost of the rooms, and the area was rather noisy at night, especially on the street side. On the plus side, the beds were comfortable, and the staff was (in general) very nice.
reviews.title: Overpriced for the quality of the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our recent trip to Hawaii, we stopped in Honolulu to see Pearl Harbor and shop before continuing on to the Big Island and stayed 2 nights at the Moana Surfrider. We stayed in the recently renovated Banyan Wing in a partial Oceanview room. While the Banyan Wing is very beautiful and they have done a good job with the renovations, the rooms are small and the bathroom is incredibly small, only big enough for 1 person to be in at a time, which can be challenging if you're trying to get ready quickly. If you can stay in the Tower Wing for a similar price, I would recommend doing so, but I have no complaints about the quality of the room, just it's size.
reviews.title: Great location, small / nice rooms in Banyan Wing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is beautiful if you want to be in the middle of the action in Waikiki, but is a little loud if you're looking for a quiet, relaxing location.
reviews.title: classy lady of hawaii

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With regards to service, all experiences were good, except for the concierge desk, which closed at 9PM, and had not delivered travel vouchers for a tour we were doing early the morning after we arrived. In a location like Waikiki, where shopping is open until 11PM! the concierge desk should be open later.
reviews.title: Good try but Diamond is a bad word here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read all the reviews on trip advisors and stayed in the tower with ocean view. Wonderful views and it feel likes you are on the beach. had dinner at grill near the superb banyan tree, food was average but what a location. Did a morning walk down the beach and back. Only stayed for one night but nice operation, i thought for AAA rate of 370 was good value. easy taxi ride from airport, 40 usd, the traffic is just terrible as a rule
reviews.title: pure bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great hotel but we too got stuck in that horrible Diamond wing, they also promised us a move to another room in the morinng but when we went down we were told there was nithing available all day
reviews.title: Serene Moana
We still love the "First Lady"
reviews.text: There can't be many English couples like us, who have come back to the Moana for three years on the bounce.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We always spend a week on one of the other islands (we've now done Maui, Kauai and now the Big Island) but we always make sure we have ten days in Waikiki.
reviews.title: As friendly as a small hotel, but with the ammenities of a big one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: It's very expensive for us Brits at the moment (what with our exchange rate at $1.38 = £1.00. We paid $1500 for an upgrade to Premium Ocean View, but with that view of Waikiki, it was well worth it.
reviews.title: Wonderful Waikiki!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Everything about the Moana is pure opulence and I still think she is one of the premium hotels in the world, and we've been to quite a few, I can tell you.
reviews.title: Lovely but crowded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We won't be back for a while, as we intend to do Bora Bora next year, but this is the classiest of all the Waikiki hotels in our opinion, so don't think twice about going there.
reviews.title: Starwood Properties - Esp. the Westin are always top notch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a room in the Banyan Wing for 3 nights in early May. We originally booked the room last July and checked the rate again a couple of weeks before leaving and it had gone down $100 per night, so obviously we called to cancel and rebook which was no problem. As other reviewers have said, the rooms in the Banyan Wing are a bit small, but nice. Strangely, the room was configured so that the TV could not be seen from the bed because of 2 large windows in the room. This is an elegant hotel in a great location. If you are looking for a jungle like lobby with parrots, etc you may want to investigate other hotels. Overall it was very nice.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — The daily charge for in room internet access.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in April and May, 2008. Overall it was great, and we would recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in a beautiful historic property with modern amenities and courteous staff. That said, there was some room for improvement. I understand that the property was a Sheraton until June, 2007, when it was renovated into a Westin (both Starwood properties, but I find Westins are a bit nicer). In sum, the hotel now looks like a Westin and, for the most part, feels like a Westin, but there were some details that let me down.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great location

likes.disliked: — $7.50 per minute for basic internet in the business center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: First, the good stuff. The hotel itself is beautiful and luxurious. There is a wonderful courtyard featuring a huge banyan tree. They have a traditional tea service on the veranda, and a nice beach bar, where you can sit in the shade and enjoy the view of Waikiki beach. They also have a small private beach area right by the edge of the hotel, which is nice because the beach is rather narrow where the hotel sits.
reviews.title: Beautiful exterior and exceptional location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an ocean view room in the Tower wing on the 13th floor. The view was fantastic, looking down Waikiki beach to Diamondhead. The first night we ordered room service and ate our dinner on the balcony. It was a great way to unwind from the stress of traveling to the island.
reviews.title: Great location, good service, room on the smallish side.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very large and, as a result, part of it was strangely empty. But, it gave us a place to set our luggage. There were plenty of drawers, but the closet was in the bathroom. It was big enough (with a safe), but the placement was sort of weird, and the doors kept sliding off the tracks. Still, it was clean and nicely adorned. It was just apparent that it was a remodel of an old design.
reviews.title: My second stay at the Surfrider - we loved it!

likes.liked: — Fresh, modern decor in the Tower wing. Great pool/beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and myself are just finishing a 5 day stay. The Hotel does have a nice setting but it is let down by a few things. The food is below average and for a 5 star hotel its almost embarrasing. Secondly the room, which is ok, is never cleaned properly. Old shampoo bottles are left in the bathroom as well as any drink cans etc. Basically they just come in and make the bed.
reviews.title: Could be better

likes.disliked: — food, noise from outside and poor housekeeping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Average at best and noisy. .
reviews.title: Hard to beat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time at this hotel – some of the other comments on here seem very unfair and over-expectant.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, beautiful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location – great location, right in the heart of Waikiki, and one of the few hotels to back right on to the beach. Great to be able to walk out of your hotel and 30 seconds later be on the beach. Very well situated for the local bus service, so we never had to rent a car, always a plus!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in – we got checked in immediately, the desk staff were very courteous and had upgraded us as it was our anniversary. While completing the process, we were presented with beads and a lei, as well as very refreshing lemongrass juice. If you stay here definitely enroll in the Starwood program before you book to get extra very worthwhile benefits.
reviews.title: Worst honeymoon experience ever

likes.liked: — the restaurant was pretty good. They had delicious shellFish
likes.disliked: — the pool was horrible! NO SEATS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: We stay at least every few years and it is expensive for what the rooms are.
reviews.title: Slipping, but still one of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the Banyan Tree area is just too good to change our Waikiki destination to elsewhere.
reviews.title: An oasis on Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This time the breakfasts were poor, maybe 2/10. As I had booked a birthday dinner on the verandah I was very worried. However it was 9/10 and a very pleasant surprise. 12 people about USD 2600 so good value including French champagne & cocktails. We'll be back!!
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms, prime location, but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from our anniversary vacation to Hawaii which started at the Surfrider. First, let me say that this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. Period. All staff was courteous, helpful and displayed what we came to learn was the "Aloha spirit" of genuine friendliness. When you arrive, you walk into an open air lobby with plenty of comfortable seating that is good for the soul.
reviews.title: Amazingly beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was an ocean view in the newer tower and the view is literally stunning! Looking out to Waikiki at 6:00 am, you will see dozens of early morning surfers lining up on their boards 100 yards out on the ocean. They are there all day, catching waves. We had complimentary champagne waiting for us in the room because of our anniversary - a very nice touch. The room was great - done in Hawaiian style. The bathroom amenities were great, the bed as well. the lanai was not large, but we kept the door open at night (the temperature was such that we did not need air conditioning) and were gently lulled to sleep by the pulsing of the waves breaking on shore. Incredible!
reviews.title: Simply Elegant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The outside of the building is very impressive. The location is great--right across from the International Market. The lobby is beautiful and the walk through to the Veranda is inspiring. The greeting complete with lei, cold towel and cold drink was perfect. Loved the rocking chairs on the little porch outside the front. The biggest disappointment was the room. We booked a standard city view room with a king size bed in the newly renovated historic building. They wanted to do us a favor by upgrading us to an oceanfront room but it had a queen size bed. Sounds wonderful, right? The room was as big as a closet and as a corner room with the sun beating in it was hot even with the A/C on. There was only a shower-no tub and I was totally disappointed. We went down to the front desk and they explained all of the rooms in the historic buildings were the same size and without tubs. So much for my evening soak in bubbles. Okay, if that's the case, I opted for the originally selected king size bed in the city view room. I expected to look out the window and see the avenue. Wrong again! We had to keep the shutters closed the entire time because we faced the lanais on the building next door. So much for privacy if we wanted daylight. And they were right, the rooms were the same size. The door to the room just had enough clearance from the bed to open.
reviews.title: Sadly Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No complaints about the service or the beach. We were able to get seats in the shade whenever we wanted. As previous posters noted, no seats available at the pool. We had dinner at the Beach House restaurant and it was worth the money. Both food and service were outstanding.
reviews.title: What an awesome place

likes.disliked: — A little on the expensive side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008
reviews.text: My girlfriend took me on a surprise long weekend to Hawaii and we stayed at the Moana Surfrider. This is, without question, the best hotel in the Waikiki beach area. The service was outstanding (typical Westin) and the ammenities were over the top. We were greeted with small "shot glasses" of some sort of iced tea beverage while we were checking in, as well as a cool towel. Very nice.
reviews.title: Elegance on a busy street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in the older section of the hotel which had been recently renovated (so it was really nice). The only complaint was that the rooms were a little on the small side. That said, who spends much time in their room in Hawaii? Our room was on the top floor (6th) so the views were outstanding (even though our room faced the street and not the ocean)
reviews.title: Classic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is ideal as you can walk from the lobby, through the outdoor restaurant (with a giant Banyan tree in the middle) right onto a private portion of the beach (only for hotel guests) and then right onto the famous Waikiki beach. Perfect!
reviews.title: Old fashioned elegance with Westin touches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second trip to Oahu. On our first trip, my husband and I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo (great hotel now that the renovations are done) which was a little more budget friendly (we paid double for this trip). This time, we decided we wanted to be right on the beach. We started our trip out staying at Turtle Bay on the North Shore. I was so excited to arrive at the Westin as we have a lovely Westin (Kierland) at home in Arizona. I had upgraded our room to an oceanview. Check in was a mixed experience. We receieved lemonade, a fresh towel to wash our hands, and a lei. That was a very nice way to arrive. The woman we dealt with at the front desk did not seem to have the aloha spirit unfortunately. Upon arriving in our room, I threw myself on the heavenly bed. This is one of the best beds you will ever sleep on in a hotel. I purchased one for my home after my first experience with the Westin hotel back home. We certainly had an ocean view, but no balconly. I was a little disappointed. Nonetheless, it was still a fabulous room, or so I thought. I entered the bathroom which was MINUTE. There was no room to put toiletries. There was a corner shower and no bath. My previous experience with other Westin's has been very luxurious bathrooms. For the price we paid for our room and the upgrade, I expected the same quality. The bathroom was immaculate and very modern; I will give the Moana Surfrider that. I called downstairs and said that we needed a room with a tub. I guess I wasn't clear because they gave us a room with a small tub and a shower curtain. I was very disappointed. The front desk tried to claim that their towers were completely sold out. I know this couldn't possibly be true because everyday the newspapers were speaking of the low occupancy at all the hotels on the islands. I would just suggest to Westin that if you have guests that you try and accomodate or at least be honest. We dealt with the bathroom situation though I was not happy. The hotel lobby is lovely. The pool was great though they need a hot tub. A word of warning about The Beachhouse - it is completley overpriced for every meal. At breakfast I hade delicious waffles that were worth the price (14). One morning I ordered oatmeal with bruleed bananas. Sounds divine, right? For $10 it was quick oats with some carmalized bananas and not carmalized very well. We had dessert at The Beachhouse one night, but decided we could find equally as good food without being gouged. We certainly did. Try Indigo in downtown Honolulu. Insanely good- our second best meal on the island. If you stay off the main drag in Waikiki, or head to downtown, you can find some of the best food you will ever eat. I do have to say the best meal on the island was at Ola's at Turtle Bay. Go there. You won't be disappointed. And if you are up on the North Shore, get the chocolate haupia pie at Ted's across from Sunset Beach. Anyway, try Coco Cove, across the street and down a little ways (near the Atlantis Restaurant). Coco Cove is like the ABC Store, only better. They sell yummy sandwiches, salads, sushi, and goodies and very reasonable prices for lunch on the beach or by the pool. Overall, the Westin was lovely, and I would certainly recommend it to anyone, despite the situation with the bathroom and being gouged on prices at the restaurant . The Moana Surfrider is in an ideal location and you will sleep well. One more item, if you would like to use the business center, it is $7.50 per ten minutes to use this service. Many other Oahu hotels offer this service free.
reviews.title: Hevenly Bed..Horrible Bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed a the Surfrider only two nights on our honeymoon. The front desk staff was nice enough to upgrade our room to an oceanview. We were greeted with flower lays, a cool drink and a towel. The hotel itself is beautiful with great seating areas and the bar area at night is the perfect spot to catch the sunset and catch the nightly entertainment. The main part of the hotel is quite old and charming. The only downside is that if you get a room in the original part of the hotel they are pretty small. We barely had room to put our luggage but once we got situated it wasn't bad. The hotel is on an ideal place right on the beach. The views are wonderful but the beach is quite crowded (as expected anywhere in Waikiki). I would definitely go again and recommend to a friend.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel- great history

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I came here with some girlfriends of mine and we loved this hotel! It's located right on the beach, right in the middle of the main street on Waikiki Beach. We could easily walk to anything on either side of us. The hotel is really beautiful and historic, with an early 1900's plantation home type look to it. The rooms are beautiful and large, pretty typical Westin rooms with a little Hawaiian flair to them. We stayed in the new wing, but we saw some rooms in the historic wing, that had a little more character to them. The pool bar underneath the Banyan tree, right on the sand, is the best out there. The atmosphere at night is beautiful with the soft lighting and candles on the tables, Hawaiian music and a hula dancer, and the best drinks I found anywhere. I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Perfect location and best lava flows!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at Moana Surfrider after traveling around the States. We were very much looking forward to our stay here. We had booked a City View room and found it to be the smallest room I have ever seen. I could not believe that they charge so much for such a tiny room. They room is only large enough to fit a King bed and thats it! We ended up upgrading to the next room category in the Tower Wing.
reviews.title: A bit disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the good side, the hotel is undoubtedly in the best location. You can walk straight out of the hotel and you are in the heart of the shopping and eating district. The hotel is also very beautiful and elegant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautifully appointed, with a great beach bar outside. The views of Waikiki Beach are great, as is the mellow nightly entertainment. Loved all the chairs on the verandas so that you could just sit and soak up the views. Our room was quite spacious. The hotel was walking distance to all of the shopping in Waikiki Beach. Would definitely recommend staying there.

Sheraton Moana Surfrider
reviews.text: From the moment we walked in ... it was heavenly. We were greeted at check in with juice, hot towels, leis, and free postcards with free postage to anywhere. The rooms were large and clean. The beach scene was the best! The outdoor cafe had music in the afternoon. And we were right in the heart of the shopping district. We didn't want to leave. It is a fabulous hotel and we have been all over the world.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently returned from a nine day stay at the Moana Surfrider (3 days in Feb. - 6 in Mar. around 3 weeks in Maui). On our first stay we booked a room in the old building - city view. This was a very small room and upon our return in March requested a larger room. Unfortunately in it was on the second floor -city view and was extremely noisy. With the street entertainers playing drums and saxophones, the motorcycles, garbage trucks and spring breakers it was difficult to get a decent night's sleep and we finally had to resort to earplugs. If you are going to stay here I strongly suggest paying the extra money for a room on the beach side and avoiding the old building and the city view rooms.

reviews.title: Quality Experience at the Moana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I did a lot of research before hand. Westin hotels are great because their heavenly beds are so comfortable. Right when we arrived at hotel it was so beautiful and charming. The check in greeted us with this amazing fresh brewed tea and leis. The rooms are small but very clean and modern. The whole hotel smelled like "white tea" from their heavenly hotel collection. You can purchase online after your trip or in gift shop to remind you of your vacation. We also enjoyed having breakfast on the back porch in the mornings with music and cocktails under the banyan tree during sunset. Try the "tropical itch" you get a actual back scratcher in your drink! Also we did surfing right out the back of the hotel on waikiki beach and we say a HUGE sea turtle. The beach can get a lil crowded but it is because the hotel location is so prime it is in the center of it all. Short walk to all the ABC stores, cute restaurants, shopping, acquarium. We parked our rental car right across the street. From the moment we arrive until we left I had no doubt we booked the perfect hotel for a great price. Also I would recommend doing your research of pricing for deals, but we ended up using a AAA discount directly on westin's site.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: While this is a beautiful hotel, I can't say the same for the stay. What other travelers have said about the noise level in the rooms facing the street is more true than you can imagine, and housekeeping took a rather expensive bathing suit cover-up out of my bathroom (I believe by accident...it was white and made of terry cloth). When I discovered it was missing a few hours after housekeeping had left I went down and spoke to someone at the front desk. They called laundry and when I asked what would happen if they could not find it they said, "I don't know, but housekeeping will follow up with you," and shrugged their shoulders. I went down every day for the next two days to check in and every time the person I spoke to would call laundry and the same thing would happen. Finally, I asked to speak to the manager and she came out and was very dismissive, telling me, "Housekeeping will follow up with you directly." Not only did housekeeping not ever follow-up with me, they didn't keep any kind of incident on file so when I called back after we had left the hotel they had no idea what I was talking about and asked me to write a letter and send in a receipt for the coverup (as if I save every receipt for everything I've ever bought) and they'd "see what we can do." I have never ever complained about a hotel's service in my life to a hotel itself or on any message board, probably even when I might have been justified. I was more than gracious to the staff about it, explaining every time that I believed the housekeeper took it by accident, but as the days progressed and the hotel made no attempt to rectify the situation and increasingly treated me like I was a nuisance rather than a customer, I started to actually feel like I was a nuisance rather than someone who'd had a possession removed from her room. And the noise. OH, THE NOISE.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, Ugly stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have NEVER stayed in a room that noisy, not even in Vegas during New Year's. The room seemed to be some kind of conduit that sucked the street noise right into it. We were directly facing the street but we were 11 stories up so you wouldn't think it would be a problem but it was nothing short of mind boggling how noisy it was. We swore the street was actually quieter than the room. If you are planning on staying here, MAKE SURE you are not near the street unless you are an insomniac, and if that is the only room they have then you better go buy a noise machine. That's what we had to do to ensure our toddler could sleep, and even with it on the highest volume and earplugs we could still hear the drums until past midnight and were woken up by the sounds of delivery trucks backing up and slamming doors starting at 4:30 in the morning. It was truly awful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We went to Honolulu for the Pro Bowl and stayed at the Sheraton Moana. The hotel was elegant, but the carpet was dated. The hotel was last remodeled in 1989. Our room was a deluxe ocean front in the Diamond Head wing. We had a large bedroom with a king sized bed, desk, armoire with fridge, drawers, and a TV with wireless keyboard. We had a very tiny, half oval lanai with a spectacular view of the lawns and beach. However, the bathroom was tiny. The toiletries were nice; shampoo, conditioner, dental kit, lotion, aloe gel and a vanity kit. They were replaced each day. The food at the Beachside Cafe was adequate, nothing great. We did the breakfast buffet each day, and at $24.99 per person, it was expensive for what you get, however, if you ordered a la carte off the menu, one small breakfast was about $19.99, so the buffet is the better deal. We ate lunches at the Beachside Bar, and again, nothing spectacular, but expensive. I would suggest many of the restaurant around the Moana rather than eating at the hotel. We did not eat dinner at the hotel, but from perusing the menu, it was extremely expensive. We did do room service and again, nothing spectacular for a lot of money.

In fact any of the street facing rooms are very noisy with small windows that do not easily open. AC is iffy at best in the Diamond Wing and the Historic Wing. The pool is a small, round one with plenty of seating. The beach has many small beach chairs and umbrella tables, as well as cabanas for rent. The beach is gentle and very swimable. There is a sand bar off Waikiki, so one can walk quite far out.

reviews.text: In June of 2007, this hotel will become a Westin and the room prices will increase accordingly. All the rooms are being remodeled, as well as all the hallways with new carpet, wallpaper and overhead lighting. On our Historic Tour, we saw what one of the Historic rooms will look like. They are removing all the bathtubs and there will be showers only. I expect there will be quite a bit of construction, so I would suggest contacting the hotel directly before booking after May 2007.
reviews.title: Best Location but expensive
Wonderful hotel and staff
reviews.text: This is a great hotel with great location. The beginning was a tough start as the reservation staff made a mistake but the manager made up for it immediately. I have researched all the hotels and this is a great value for your $$$. Of course it is a little pricey but I would pay that price to be in the middle of the action. The amenities were unbelievable... the beach bar was romantic...the view was amazing... the staff were courteous (especially the concierge). I would come back here in a heart beat. CONS: Do not eat there..food is lousy, got a spring roll for $10 and got two thin eggrolls. Then tried the buffet at their beachside cafe-- another huge disappointment. Definitely great to stay in but not to dine in. Please do try the Lava flow at their Beach Bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Moana Surfrider from 20th January 2007 - 26th January 2007 in a Tower Deluxe Ocean Front Room. We booked online and got a cheaper price than if we booked through our travel agent. We paid an average of USD$390.00 per night + tax which works out very expensive when you convert it to our Australian currency (Over $500 per night AUD. But we thought it was well worth it as we were travelling the mainland USA for 2 months prior and were finishing our holiday in Hawaii so we decided to pay the money and enjoy the room and views. On check in we were gretted with a hot towel to refresh our face with, a beautiful fresh flower orchid lei each and nice cold fresh guava juice to quench our thirst. Nice touch.We had a great size room with a good size balcony that overlooked Waikiki beach and Diamond Head. The bed was awesome king size and very very comfortable with feather pillows. The room had a fridge and coffee maker and nice size flat screen TV. There was also a big writing desk and chair that looked out to the ocean. The bathroom had good quality amentities and was a great size. There was also an inroom safe in the wardobe in the bathroom. They also supply you with 2 big fluffy robes to wear after your shower. We spent alot of time in the courtyard under the magnificent Banyan tree. This area with its bar is a great place to unwind and have a drink and a bite to eat. There hot fries are the best I had eaten while in America for 8 weeks. There chicken pita bread iwith cucumber yoghurt was awesome too. We hired a car and travelled around the island one day. About $70 for a PT Cruiser convertible through Thrifty Car rentals. This was a great way too experience the island. Pearl Harbour is about a 30 minute drive away and that is a must see along with Paradise Cove Luau is another must do. The hotel is situated in a perfect location right in the middle of everything. Subway is across the road on the next block and there are plenty of restaurants to choose from nearby. we enjoyed drinks and a feed at the Tiki Bar just up the road. The pool area is quite small in size in comparison to the size of the hotel and if you want a beach chair on the beach you had better get there early. There is live entertainment each night which is very relaxing after a day of sightseeing. You really don't need to leave this resort. Everything is here for you.Overall our experience was A1 at the Moana and you certainly get what you pay for-service,quality and a lifetime of memories. We would definately stay here again if our budget allows us.
